decks.notes: The deck focuses on powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to control the board. The deck has a toolbox approach with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Stoneforge Mystic helping to search for key creatures and equipment as needed. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly building a strong board presence to outpace and overwhelm them.

The focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and aggressively pressure the opponent's life total with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Young Pyromancer. The deck includes a suite of cantrips and counterspells to maintain card advantage and protect its threats, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt to close out games. The mana base is streamlined to support the UR color identity and includes utility lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to fill the graveyard with key cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp using cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough. This allows the player to quickly bring back creatures like Ichorid and Narcomoeba from the graveyard, triggering cards like Bridge from Below. By utilizing cards like Cabal Therapy and Cephalid Coliseum to disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creatures and tokens for a quick victory.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, and then cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play using Show and Tell or Sneak Attack. By getting these big threats into play early, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can respond effectively. The deck also includes a number of card draw and counter spells to help protect its key combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, aiming to overwhelm opponents with early threats and efficient burn spells. It includes powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist, along with disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its board presence. The mana base is streamlined and optimized for consistency, with access to fetch lands and dual lands for optimal color fixing. The deck seeks to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game, leveraging its versatile spell suite and selection tools to secure victories.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Stoneforge Mystic to disrupt opponent's strategies while applying pressure. It aims to slow down opponents with tools like Rishadan Port and Wasteland, while also providing protection with cards like Mother of Runes. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for creatures to be played at instant speed, keeping opponents on their toes. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and quick, efficient creatures to secure victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly and efficiently as possible. It utilizes cards such as Vampire Hexmage, Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Thespian's Stage to quickly create the legendary 20/20 flying indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck also includes disruption cards like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Inquisition of Kozilek to protect the combo from opponents' interference. Additionally, the inclusion of Mox Diamond and a variety of fetch lands helps to ensure consistent mana production and fixing for the combo pieces.

This deck is focused on quickly playing aggressive creatures and spells to put pressure on the opponent. The key strategy is to control the board with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce while maintaining a fast pace with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer. By constantly applying pressure and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The deck utilizes a mix of cheap spells, versatile creatures, and land disruption to maintain a proactive game plan.

The deck revolves around efficiently assembling the Dark Depths combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token as quickly as possible. It includes cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Thespian's Stage to search for or copy Dark Depths, along with disruption like Thoughtseize and Pithing Needle to protect the combo. Not of This World is included as protection against spot removal or counterspells. The deck aims to consistently and swiftly assemble the combo while disrupting the opponent?s game plan.

The deck focuses on maximizing board presence and tempo through cheap and efficient spells like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, Young Pyromancer, and Lightning Bolt. It utilizes cantrips like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to dig for threats and disrupt the opponent. Control elements like Daze, Force of Will, and Wasteland help protect and pressure the opponent. the mana base is focused on fetching for dual lands to facilitate the deck's color requirements. Ultimately, the deck aims to win through early aggression and disruption.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents' hands and controlling the board with a mix of counterspells, removal, and versatile threats like Baleful Strix and Gurmag Angler. The deck also leverages planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils to provide card advantage and further control the game. With a well-rounded suite of disruption spells and efficient threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and grind out incremental advantage until it can secure a decisive win.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Trinisphere, Chalice of the Void, and Abrupt Decay. It also aims to generate incremental advantage through value cards like Sylvan Library, Green Sun's Zenith, and Wrenn and Six. Additionally, the deck has a strong graveyard recursion theme with cards like Meren of Clan Nel Toth and Ramunap Excavator, as well as a land destruction component with cards like Wasteland. The deck also includes a versatile toolbox of creatures like Tarmogoyf, Titania, Protector of Argoth, and Courser of Kruphix.

This Legacy deck focuses on tempo and disruption, utilizing counterspells like Force of Will, Spell Snare, and Spell Pierce to control the game while deploying threats like True-Name Nemesis, Delver of Secrets, and Pteramander. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Wasteland and Stifle to slow down the opponent's game plan, while also using cards like Daze and Curious Obsession to maintain aggression and card advantage. The overall strategy of the deck is to disrupt the opponent's plan while maintaining pressure on the board to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using Stoneforge Mystic to fetch powerful equipment such as Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, it has efficient card draw in Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as versatile threats in True-Name Nemesis, Snapcaster Mage, and Baleful Strix. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with powerful threats and control elements.

This deck relies on quickly ramping up mana with the Cloudpost and Glimmerpost lands, as well as powerful mana artifacts like Grim Monolith and Thran Dynamo. The main goal is to accelerate into big Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer, while also utilizing planeswalkers like Karn, Ugin, and Sorcerous Spyglass for disruption and control. Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere are used to slow down opponents and protect the deck's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats and powerful board presence.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, control the board, and outvalue the opponent with powerful card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils. Utilizing versatile threats like Dreadhorde Arcanist and True-Name Nemesis, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, the deck aims to grind out advantages over time and win through card advantage and attrition. The deck also includes a solid counterspell package with Force of Will to protect its key threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.
